problem:
Let $0 \le a \le 1$ and $0 \le b \le 1.$  Find the largest possible value of
\[\frac{a + b}{ab + 1}.\]
solution:
Since $0 \le a \le 1$ and $0 \le b \le 1,$
\[(1 - a)(1 - b) \ge 0.\]Then $1 - a - b + ab \ge 0,$ so $a + b \le ab + 1.$  Hence,
\[\frac{a + b}{ab + 1} \le 1.\]Equality occurs when $a = b = 1,$ so the maximum value is $\boxed{1}.$
